website_summaries.verdict: With the fantastic stability, support and fit that the The New Balance Minimus 10 v1 provides, a lot of users were made satisfied and happy. Aside from its well-constructed structure, the shoe also offers the right amount of comfort, style, and traction when used in various trails. While others have issues with the toe box and size, others still lauded the shoe because of its versatility and performance. Overall, the New Balance Minimus 10 v1 is an excellent choice for those who are looking for a breathable, comfortable and durable running shoe.
pros: Some reviewers loved its lightweight structure
Many wearers mentioned that the New Balance Minimus 10 v1 was one of the most supportive shoes they have ever worn
Some of the purchasers agreed that the shoe has a durable outsole
A good number of wearers commented that the cushioning was great
The New Balance Minimus 10 v1 was comfortable, according to many runners
Many consumers noted that the shoe was breathable
The majority of the buyers noted that the shoe provided enough stability
Based on some reviews, the New Balance Minimus 10 v1 was stylish
A handful of testers said that the shoe was great for walking, mountain biking, kayaking, hiking, running and casual occasions
cons: Some users commented that the shoe is not recommended for high-impact movements
Based on observations, the New Balance Minimus 10 v1 runs small
According to runners who have tried it, the upper mesh ripped easily after several uses only
The shoe has a narrow toe box, noted by some of the users
A lot of runners wished to have other color options available

website_summaries.verdict: The New Balance Minimus Trail 10 is a minimalist shoe that is lauded by many for allowing good ground feel and control. Many have been satisfied with the overall versatility delivered by the shoe as it can be worn for different activities. The outsole of the shoe also promotes good ground traction on different terrains. A lot of people claim that they would surely recommend these shoes to their peers.
pros: A lot of the runners appreciate the New Balance Minimus Trail 10 for enhancing ground connectivity
the shoe is the ideal exhibit of minimalist running shoe
The shoe is very comfortable to the foot, remarked several users
The lightweight construction of the shoe is very appreciable, stated several testers
Several runners commend the breathability offered by the mesh upper of this New Balance trail running shoe
Because of the Vibram® outsole of the Minimus Trail 10, good ground traction is achieved, expressed by many people
The shoe is highly flexible, stated some reviewers
The runners also praise the protection extended by the shoe
cons: One buyer is dismayed with the easily worn out outsole of the Minimus Trail 10
Several reviewers have complained about the heel of the shoe digging into their Achilles tendon which causes some pain

customer_reviews.title: Poor Revision of a Quality Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these shoes for many years and have always had a size 8.5, half a size bigger than my size in every other running shoe I have ever tried. Yet, when these arrived the rubber across the toes was so tight I couldn't even walk in them let alone run! These were a well designed and comfortable barefoot running shoe which has now been ruined by poor design. These are either faulty or just poorly constructed as to make the shoe so tight across the toe box is crazy in a shoe that it meant to allow the toes to expand as in all minimalist type shoes. Avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for mid-foot running
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in mid-foot barefoot style style running shoes since 2012 and I think these are the most stylish and comfortable I have ordered. I have had the minimus zeros, vivo barefoots and vibram five fingers and these are the best for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, buy a size up from your normal size!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman and I bought these because the womens shoes were more expensive on here than the mens. I checked the sizing and they actually use womens sizing despite this being advertised as a mens shoe. I'm usually a size 7 wide and went for the size 8 and it didn't leave much room for my foot which was perfect. Great for running on soft ground, but as theres not much padding definitely reduce how much you run on concrete, or at least build up to it.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Love these trainers!
customer_reviews.text: I've finally retired my original pair after a lot of use. I love that NB have re-released them although the fit is a little narrower in the toe box than they used to be. I'm not much of a runner but, regularly use these trainers for lifting and circuit type training. I feel connected to the ground and stable through all movements. The shoes are great for a wide range of activities and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: C Woo

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable walking or running
customer_reviews.text: Following the advice of other reviewers I have ordered half a size bigger. Normally, I use size 9. I never order bigger or smaller shoes, regardless what others say. but this time some intuition suggested me to deviate and order a bigger one. No regrets. Nonetheless, I found the shoes very uncomfortable walking or running on a perfectly flat road (tarmac).
customer_reviews.author: _astra_

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoe but more like a transition shoe than true barefoot feel
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and feel but more padded than my previous minimus. Tongue design take a little getting used too as only attached at one side and loose side has a lip at the edge that sits funny until you wear it in. They feel like I will get 3 years of orienteering and a half marathon out of these like my last pair ok but I might not spend 6 months trying to track down the exact same pair as I did with the previous ones before giving up and buying the new model.
customer_reviews.author: James NI

customer_reviews.title: Small fitting
customer_reviews.text: Had to return these as they were just to narrow for me on my left foot and got several blisters went a size up as well could of got a wider width but the price increases as well
customer_reviews.author: stuart

customer_reviews.title: Was gutted when they changed them but so glad the originals are back
customer_reviews.text: The only shoes I wear now. On my third pair and will buy them until they stop making them. Was gutted when they changed them but so glad the originals are back. Best. Shoes. Ever.
customer_reviews.author: Moss Everhard

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Order half a size up
customer_reviews.text: As per the advise I ordered half a size up from my usual 9. They fit perfectly albeit snug which is what I wanted. If you want a little space the order a full size up. Previously had merrell trail glove. I immediately prefer these. Great looking quality shoe
customer_reviews.author: Mr L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent with good high ankle support
customer_reviews.text: Really like these trainers. For a low heel trainer I like the fact that it is a low ankle boot type as I like to put in thick inserts for comfort. Will buy this design again.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Five star shoes and five star service!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these shoes that I bought. They are superb! Close fitting and lightweight. You hardly know that you’re wearing them. This pair was delivered and at a very competitive price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr M

customer_reviews.title: Order a size up
customer_reviews.text: Order a size up and they fit perfectly. Very comfortable. Look good. Great to run in on any surface
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Great for running
customer_reviews.text: Second pair I’ve had. Great for running but buy a size larger for best fit.
customer_reviews.author: TwoTarts

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a barefoot style shoe as was suffering some injuries. Had no time off and an injury free after switching to these
customer_reviews.author: Mr b

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing shoe but if you’re looking for something to last you longer this might not be the right pair for you
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Best Barefoot gym shoes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit - tough lightweight materials and breathable just right for my requirements
customer_reviews.author: Sullah66

customer_reviews.title: Looks good too
customer_reviews.text: Great minimal running shoe and doesn’t look as dorky as most others on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Declan

customer_reviews.title: Great training shoes, sizing is small
customer_reviews.text: sizing Is small: order a half size up from what you normally would.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: For very, very narrow feet only
customer_reviews.text: One of the most important things about barefoot shoes is a sufficiently large toe-box. This allows the ball of the foot, toes and arch to flex properly. These shoes seemed fundamentally flawed, in that they had a narrow toe-box with additional rubber bracing extending up from the sole - making them even more cramped and inflexible. I've worn barefoot trainers and shoes for about 8 years now and these are the only ones that were instantly painful and excruciatingly tight. Furthermore, the heel seemed loose. I own NB Minimus trainers that I bought many years ago and they're incomparably superior.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Look good but sizes are small
customer_reviews.text: They look really good but run very small. Need to get at least one size bigger. But even with the right shoe size they are still very narrow compared to most barefoot/minimalist trainers
customer_reviews.author: Mak

customer_reviews.title: Sole detaches after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: The fit nicely, and run well. After 1 month using 2 times a week the soles peeled off. I then glued them back on, and the rest peeled off 2 months later (pictures shown). Really badly glued for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Artur

customer_reviews.title: Great Trail running minimalist trainers
customer_reviews.text: Ive worn this particular type of trainer for years. It's like bare foot running with the protection of a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: bodenton

customer_reviews.title: Very small made shoe, weight and feel is okay ...
customer_reviews.text: Very small made shoe, weight and feel is okay but after 4 miles the ball of my foot becomes very sore at one point due to the layout of the grip on the sole of the shoe, unbearable after about 10 miles, disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: lee

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's Minimus 10 Trail Running Shoes
feature_bullets: Breathable Mesh Upper - Provides ventilation, keeping your feet feeling cool and comfortable.
Synthetic Overlays - Provides a stable fit and reduces the risk of chafing or irritation.
Midfoot Wrap - Provides a comfortable and snug fit.
Oder Resistant Lining - Prevents the growth of odour causing microbes.
Acteva Midsole - Engineered foam that resists compression set.
